review_title: Repenting long-term stay at FCA - Chennai
pros:
The following points penned down in this review is a collective observation of my association with FCA for 5 years. 

1. Learning opportunities : The organisation is an open library and the global counterparts are always willing to help. Learning in this organisation is vested upon the individual and it is also team specific.

2. No discrimination between onroll and offrole employees. 

3. Cab facility is a plus for people coming from different parts of the city.
cons:
1. Employee respect : Employees will be treated like slaves, every action of the management speaks for itself. Treatment of employees is based on favourism of the management.

2. Work : Only a few teams work program specific whilst majority of them act as support team for other global regions. Whilst a few work very hard, this organisation allows many to slouch without doing any work. Work life balance takes a toll for people who out heart and soul into work, but end of the day get no credit or the compensation.

3. Compensation : Easily this organisation is in the bottom in terms of compensation amongst all the automotive OEM in India. There's no defined process for hike cycle, in the last 3years employees have received one hike of 5% for the year 2018. Salary parity between employees is huge and there's no standardization. Employees working in this organisation for long term often have the worst salaries in the market. Bonus is a key highlight of the offer, apart from being an addition to the CTC offered, in reality the bonus. 

4. Employee Retention : Even the best of employees are not retained/ not a single effort is taken to retain the employee. Asking for a salary rise is often considered rude/frowned upon eventhough one deserves it.

5. Management : No one in the organisation knows who the management is. The blame game happens between managers' and HRs', ultimately no one takes decision.

6. Planning : Things take a comical turn interms of planning, employees share laptops/PC's/chairs/storage compartments in shifts. WFH during locking was a chaos, weekly return to office mail even before the new office was fully constructed was a comical taunting. 

7. Trainings : No formal trainings, fresher induction in place in comparison to other Automotive OEM's. Don't be shocked if one is put to work the very first day.

8. Growth potential : Any individual will be allowed to grow based on the favouritism showed by the manager. The only growth potential is onroll, onsite visits (cutback due to covid) and position(if available). Do not expect to grow financially in this organisation.

End Note : 
This organisation is best suited for :
1. Intermediate jumps in career/ short-term stay.
2. Someone who is looking to settle down in their career.
3. For overtly enthusiastic individual who are willing to learn.

cons:
With change in management twice in the the last 9 years, the corporate direction has not been laser focused. The future product plan seems to be lacking, opting to use strategic partnerships to fill the holes. Many issues that Chrysler has with perceived quality is a leftover from the Daimler management.  Cost targets took precedence over product features.  Many features that are "minimum to market entry", like soft IPs and door trim, map lights, map pockets in the seat backs were eliminated.


The financial crisis has forced significant layoffs and voluntary separations. Many of the support personnel have left and positions eliminated.  My fear is that some administrative functions will become cumbersome, since the people that knew the systems best, are no longer available, or have an overwhelming workload.
